The third angel's message is virtually ignored by you. You have belittled the work of the gospel ministry, while you have made the medical missionary work disproportionately important. You have weakened where you should have strengthened. You would bear no restriction. You were determined, if you could, to set in operation the work you had planned, but this work God has never given you to do.--Letter 41, 1900, pp. 2, 3, 4. (To J. H. Kellogg, March 10, 1900.)
